meanings.definition: Push, elbow, or bump against (someone) roughly, typically in a crowd.
meanings.sent1: The children were jostling each other to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent2: The fans were jostling for a better view of the stage at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were jostling over the last acorn in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The waves jostled the boats in the harbor during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The students were jostling to grab the last piece of pizza at the party.

meanings.definition: Compete for space or attention in a forceful or aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: The companies were jostling for the top spot in the market.
meanings.sent2: The politicians were jostling for media coverage during the election campaign.
meanings.sent3: The cats were jostling for the warmest spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The clouds jostled for space in the sky as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The players were jostling for the coach's attention during the game.
